message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with automated segmentation and clustering of human motion data, which is a common problem in computer vision and machine learning. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The use of neighbourhood graphs and similarity information also suggests that the paper may belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The application of the method to sensor modalities such as electromyograph and accelerometer recordings suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Finally, the mention of "analysis of the finer structures of motion data" suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.MM (Multimedia).
